Generation I.Red: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke 's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke 's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.
Generation I.Yellow: Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.
Generation I.Stadium: If its tail is bitten by a Shellder , Slowpoke evolves into Slowbro . The Shellder seems to like its crunchy tail.

Generation II.Gold: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke .
Generation II.Silver: Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to Shellder 's seeping poison.
Generation II.Crystal: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
Generation II.Stadium 2: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke . (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to Shellder 's seeping poison. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Slowbro 's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
Generation III.Sapphire: Slowbro 's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
Generation III.Emerald: Its tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This forces it to reluctantly swim and catch prey.
Generation III.FireRed: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder . That made it evolve into Slowbro .
Generation III.LeafGreen: The Shellder that latches onto Slowpoke 's tail is said to feed on the host's leftover scraps.

Generation IV.Diamond: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
Generation IV.Pearl: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
Generation IV.Platinum: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
Generation IV.HeartGold: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke .
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to Shellder 's seeping poison.

Generation V.Black: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
Generation V.White: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
Generation V.Black 2: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
Generation V.White 2: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.

Generation VI.X: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
Generation VI.Y: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder . That made it evolve into Slowbro.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.

Generation VII.Sun: All the energy from Mega Evolution poured into the Shellder on its tail, leaving Slowpoke to be swallowed whole.
Generation VII.Moon: When bathed in the energy of Mega Evolution, Shellder converts into impregnable armor. There is virtually no change in Slowpoke .
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Tremendous energy strengthened the power of the Shellder on its tail, but it doesn't really affect Slowpoke .
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Having been swallowed whole by Shellder , Slowbro now has an iron defense. It's pretty comfortable in there, too.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Under the influence of Shellder 's digestive fluids, Slowpoke has awakened, gaining a great deal of power–and a little motivation to boot.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Under the influence of Shellder 's digestive fluids, Slowpoke has awakened, gaining a great deal of power–and a little motivation to boot.

Generation VIII.Sword: A Shellder bite set off a chemical reaction with the spices inside Slowbro's body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type Pokémon.
Generation VIII.Shield: If this Pokémon squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell .
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Though usually dim-witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Though usually dim-witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Shellder seems blissful over the taste of Slowbro even though the toxins seeping from the bite have caused Shellder to faint.
Generation IX.Violet: Shellder bites down hard on Slowbro’s arm to suck out more poison. This seems to cause itching, so Slowbro occasionally lashes out.

Generation I.Red: Route 23 and Cerulean Cave ( Super Rod ) Seafoam Islands (walking)
Generation I.Blue: Route 23 and Cerulean Cave ( Super Rod ) Seafoam Islands (walking)
Generation I.Blue (Japan): Route 23 and Cerulean Cave ( Super Rod ) Seafoam Islands (walking)

Generation III.LeafGreen: Cerulean Cave and Berry Forest ( surfing ) Seafoam Islands and Cape Brink ( tall grass /walking and surfing) Cinnabar Island ( Super Rod )

Generation IV.HeartGold: Slowpoke Well and Seafoam Islands Safari Zone (Peak with 5 Waterside points; tall grass in Rocky Beach - default, with 3 Peak points, and with 5 Waterside points)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Slowpoke Well and Seafoam Islands Safari Zone (Peak with 5 Waterside points; tall grass in Rocky Beach - default, with 3 Peak points, and with 5 Waterside points)

Generation V.Black: Abundant Shrine ( Surfing in rippling water )
Generation V.White: Abundant Shrine ( Surfing in rippling water )

Generation VIII.Shield: Evolve Slowpoke Version 1.2.0+ ( Galarian Form ) Trade Version 1.2.0+ ( Kantonian Form )
